title: Iowa judge temporarily blocks 6-week abortion ban
description: An Iowa judge on Monday temporarily blocked a new six-week abortion ban from remaining in effect.

title: Kerry Kennedy rebukes brother RFK Jr. after he linked Covid-19 and Jewish people
description: Kerry Kennedy, a younger sister of Robert F. Kennedy Jr. lambasted her brother for saying Covid-19 was "targeted to attack Caucasians and Black people" and that Jewish people are most immune.

title: Jill Martin gets emotional sharing breast cancer diagnosis on 'TODAY'
description: "TODAY" contributor Jill Martin is sharing that, just a few weeks ago, she learned she has breast cancer.

title: Elizabeth Warren urges SEC to investigate Tesla over Twitter ties, corporate governance
description: Sen. Elizabeth Warren, D-Mass., sent a letter urging the U.S.

title: 14-year-old hired to animate Lego scenes in 'Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse'
description: 14-year-old animator Preston Mutanga recreated the first trailer of "Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse" with animated Legos and posted it online. The video caught the attention of the movie's filmmakers. NBC News' Gadi Schwartz talks to the animator, his parents and the filmmaker about the hiring story.

title: Long Island police search storage units in  Gilgo Beach murders
description: Authorities on Monday executed a search warrant of a second storage unit in Amityville, Long Island, related to the Gilgo Beach murders, a sprawling case that had long gone cold until the surprise arrest last week of a suspect in three of the deaths.

title: FBI charges now-husband of 'Pink Beret' Jan. 6 rioter who was turned in by her ex
description: Spencer Geller, husband of Jan. 6 defendant Jennifer Inzunza Vargas Geller who was known as "Pink Beret," has also been charged in the Jan. 6 Capitol attack.

title: Eli Lilly's experimental Alzheimer's drug slows progression of the disease, study finds
description: An Alzheimer's drug from Eli Lilly slowed decline of the disease by up to 48%, or about 7 and a half months. The drug comes with risks of serious side effects including brain bleeds.

title: Wimbledon champion Carlos Alcaraz wins thriller but says he could have 'lost in straight sets'
description: Wimbledon champion Carlos Alcaraz basked Monday in the glow of a thrilling victory over the weekend — but he conceded that he could have easily lost the title match in straight sets.

title: Microsoft agrees to keep Call of Duty on Sony Playstation after it buys Activision Blizzard
description: Microsoft has signed an agreement with Sony to keep the Call of Duty video game series on the PlayStation console after the tech giant acquires video game maker Activision Blizzard.

title: History-making heat set to spread after weekend of triple-digit temperatures
description: A history-making heat wave that baked Southern U.S. communities with triple-digit temperatures over the weekend will offer little relief this week and could spread dangerous conditions farther across the Sun Belt.

title: Detainees and advocates decry ‘horrific’ conditions at Louisiana ICE detention center
description: The Winn Correctional Center in Louisiana has been the subject of years of complaints about inadequate medical care, filthy accommodations and mistreatment.

title: Russia says Ukraine just attacked its key bridge linking Russia with Crimea
description: Ukrainian naval drones hit a key bridge linking Russia to the annexed Crimean Peninsula, killing a couple and seriously injuring their daughter, the Kremlin said Monday.

title: Millions in the U.S., around the world face record-breaking temperatures
description: Millions in the U.S., around the world face record-breaking temperatures

title: Rep. Lauren Boebert won by only 546 votes last year. She isn’t changing her ways.
description: Republican Rep. Lauren Boebert, who nearly lost in 2022, has not moderated her far-right positions or rhetoric as Democrat Adam Frisch prepares for a re-match.

title: Murdaugh 2019 boat crash lawsuits settled, lawyers say
description: Lawsuits over the deadly 2019 crash of a boat believed to have been driven by the son of South Carolina legal scion Alex Murdaugh have been settled, two lawyers familiar with the negotiations said Sunday.
